metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14440 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the ILBM image rendering functionality of SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted ILBM image can cause a stack overflow resulting in code execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14440` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
